settings.title: Record Store Day
settings.content: Record Store Day is an annual event that celebrates the cultural importance of the independent record store, highlighting the role these stores play in the community and the music industry.

settings.title: Record Store Day Walking Tour
settings.content:
Join us in supporting Record Store Day Australia as their official whiskey sponsor and help celebrate local, independent record stores on 22 April.

We will be visiting a selection of licensed independent record stores across Melbourne on rotation throughout the day to sling whiskey highball tastings for record diggers.

Vinyl fanatics digging at these select stores will also have the chance to track down a ‘golden ticket’, tucked away on one of two albums in the store. Winners of the golden tickets will win a bottle of The Gospel (18+ only).

On April 22, you'll find us roaming between:

-- FITZROY: Oh! Jean, Plug Seven, The Searchers

-- COLLINGWOOD: Skydiver, Liquorice Pie

-- ABBOTSFORD: Dutch Vinyl 

--
For a list of all participating record stores across Australia, please see the official Record Store Day website here

settings.title: Vinyl After Party
settings.content:
We will also be partnering with Paradise Alley in Collingwood for an after party, bringing a selection of vinyl DJs to play throughout the night.

From 2pm-12am, you'll find The Gospel drink specials alongside a curated schedule of vinyl DJ sets by Mr Lob, who will close the night with the last set from 10pm-12am.

Event details:
Record Store Day Vinyl After Party
Paradise Alley, Collingwood
22 April 2pm-12am

settings.title: On the Journal: record collecting
settings.content:
As part of Record Store Day, we had a chat with Lachlan Stuckey of Surprise Chef to uncover how his passion for collecting vinyl has influenced his music career.

"Scott Towers from Fat Freddy’s Drop recommended a record store in this old, decrepit apartment building in Porto. We spent ages trying to find it. We went along all these hallways, getting lost. We finally saw this open door and a wall of records was inside. There was just this dude chain smoking cigars in this tiny little office that had records stacked up everywhere with no categorisation whatsoever. [...] it’s fun finding a place like that which is a total nightmare. It just makes it more of an adventure.”
